alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 7:01PM PST until further notice by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. Issaquah Creek Near Issaquah affecting King County. Puyallup River Near Orting affecting Pierce County. Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. Chehalis River Above Doty affecting Lewis County. Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston Counties. Chehalis River At Centralia affecting Lewis County. .Heavy rain will continue today across the region, with local low elevation snow melt. This will result in continued flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Porter. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 50.0 feet, feet...the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood numerous farms and roads including SR 12. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM PST Thursday the stage was 48.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 PM PST Thursday was 48.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 52.0 feet Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 500 AM PST.
